title: Welcome to C++
description: This lesson will consist of an introduction to the C++ language and explanations of how code is run and what happens within the computer. By the end, you will understand basic structure/syntax of C++ and you should be able to write a simple program.
short: Introduction to the C++ language and its semantics

title: Variables and Data Types
description: In this lesson, we will look at variables, a useful and integral part of the of programs. We will learn how to define and use our own variables, and how we can manipulate the values stored within them. We will also learn how C++ handles variables of different data types.

title: Console I/O
description: Sometimes, we may want to input information from the console a certain way or need a way to output information in a certain format. This lesson will go over all the intricacies of taking input and output from the console using C++.
short: Understand the C++ console input and output

title: Arithmetic Operations
description: In this lesson, we will look at arithmetic operations. Arithmetic operations are used to do mathematical calculations and are used in almost every program. These can range from simple addition and subtraction to exponential calculations. We will look at how to perform such operations in C++, using functions and operators as needed.
short: Learn how to use arithmetic operations in C++

title: Conditionals
description: In this lesson, we will learn how to implement conditionals in C++. Conditionals are one of the most important control structures you will learn, and will help make your programs more interactive. You will learn how to write if-statements, switch statements, boolean expressions, and logical operators.

title: Looping
description: In this lesson, we will look at a second type of control structure: the loop. As you become more experienced in coding, you will see that most of your programs will include repeated code. Loops allow for a way to reuse the same block of code in different ways. We will also learn how you can nest loops to create more complex programs. Throughout this lesson, you will learn about the numerous loop types that C++ supports.
short: Learn to write less code and do more with loops

title: Arrays
description: In this lesson, you will learn how to use arrays. You learn how to define and manipulate them, along with related libraries. Arrays are used to represent a collection of the same data type that belong together. By the end of the lesson, you will understand the uses and limitations of arrays in C++
short: Arrays let you store more data in one variable

title: Functions
description: You have learned many functions in past lessons. Now, you will learn how to write your own functions. In programming, functions are blocks of reusable code that are used to perform a certain as coded by a user.
short: Organize and reuse code with functions

title: C++ Standard Library
description: The C++ language comes with many powerful tools for writing programs. In this lesson we will go over some commonly used libraries in the C++ standard and explain how to read and understand documentation of them. These include <string>, <vector>, <algorithm>, and more.
short: Explore new and powerful features of the C++ language

title: Debugging
description: After writing many programs, you are bound to find some problems that you just don't know how to fix. This lesson goes over some of the techniques to find the bugs in your program and how to use the C++ debugger. It also includes a brief introduction to exceptions in C++.
short: Find and squash the bugs in your program

title: Problem Solving
description: This lesson goes over how to think about solving programming challenges and translating what you want to do into code. The final lesson of our Introduction to C++ course will make sure you have all the tools needed for you to start projects of your own.
short: Prepare to jump off on your own C++ adventure
